verses.verse: By night <S%H3915><s%> on my bed <S%H4904><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%>: I sought <S%H1245><s%> him <S%H4672><s%>, but I found him not.

I said <S%H6965><s%>, I will rise now <S%H5437><s%>, and go about the city <S%H5892><s%>; In the streets <S%H7784><s%> and in the broad ways <S%H7339><s%> I will seek <S%H1245><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%>: I sought <S%H1245><s%> him <S%H4672><s%>, but I found him not.
The watchmen <S%H8104><s%> that go about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> me <S%H7200><s%>; To whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%>?

It was but a little <S%H4592><s%> that I passed <S%H5674><s%> from them <S%H4672><s%>, When I found him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%>: I held <S%H270><s%> him <S%H7503><s%>, and would not let him go, Until I had brought <S%H935><s%> him into my mother <S%H517><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, And into the chamber <S%H2315><s%> of her that conceived me <S%H2029><s%>.

I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you <S%H1323><s%>, O daughters of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, By the roes <S%H6643><s%>, or <S%H176><s%> by the hinds <S%H355><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>, That ye stir not up <S%H5782><s%>, nor awake <S%H5782><s%> my love <S%H160><s%>, Until he please <S%H2654><s%>.

Who is this that cometh <S%H5927><s%> up from the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> Like pillars <S%H8490><s%> of smoke <S%H6227><s%>, Perfumed <S%H6999><s%> with myrrh <S%H4753><s%> and frankincense <S%H3828><s%>, With all powders <S%H81><s%> of the merchant <S%H7402><s%>?
Behold <S%H8010><s%>, it is the litter <S%H4296><s%> Threescore <S%H8346><s%> mighty <S%H1368><s%> men are about <S%H5439><s%> it <S%H1368><s%>, Of the mighty men of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

They all handle <S%H270><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%>, and are expert <S%H3925><s%> in war <S%H4421><s%>: Every man <S%H376><s%> hath his sword <S%H2719><s%> upon his thigh <S%H3409><s%>, Because of fear <S%H6343><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>.
King <S%H4428><s%> Solomon <S%H8010><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> himself a palanquin <S%H668><s%> Of the wood <S%H6086><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>.

He made <S%H6213><s%> the pillars <S%H5982><s%> thereof of silver <S%H3701><s%>, The bottom <S%H7507><s%> thereof of gold <S%H2091><s%>, the seat <S%H4817><s%> of it of purple <S%H713><s%>, The midst <S%H8432><s%> thereof being paved <S%H7528><s%> with love <S%H160><s%>, From the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>.

Go forth <S%H3318><s%>, O ye daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%>, and behold <S%H7200><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> Solomon <S%H8010><s%>, With the crown <S%H5850><s%> wherewith his mother <S%H517><s%> hath crowned <S%H5849><s%> him In the day <S%H3117><s%> of his espousals <S%H2861><s%>, And in the day <S%H3117><s%> of the gladness <S%H8057><s%> of his heart <S%H3820><s%>.
